page.title: 06An unlikely sports club.
page.content: Part of an interview with the Moreton Morrell Real Tennis Club Steward. { Real Tennis}- Charles Garland,the owner of Moreton Hall wanted to become a member of Leamington Real Tennis Club but they would not let him because he was American. So he built his own court in Moreton Morrell. He built it in 1905. There are seventeen courts in the U.K.. All the courts vary in size. The British Championships were held at Moreton Morrell in 1984.The club hopes to have the World Championships in 1986. You have to be thirteen years old at least to be a member and play because of the speed of the ball and the weight of the racket.Members come from all over the world from such countries as Hong Kong,Australia and the United States of America.
